ids_info.name: workflow
ids_info.description: Description of the workflow that has produced this data entry. The workflow IDS can also be used to communicate information about workflow state between workflow components.

workflow/time_loop.documentation:
=== IMAS DATA DICTIONARY ENTRY ===
FULL_PATH: workflow/time_loop
IDS: workflow
HIERARCHY_DEPTH: 1
TOTAL_CONTEXT_LEVELS: 2
PARENT_CONTAINER: workflow
FIELD_NAME: time_loop
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: workflow -> time_loop

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Description of a workflow based on a time loop which calls components defined in component_list sequentially  during each cycle of the loop (workflow_cycle).

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[workflow]: Description of the workflow that has produced this data entry. The workflow IDS can also be used to communicate information about workflow state between workflow components.

PATH_COMPONENTS: workflow -> time_loop -> time_end

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Termination time for the workflow main time loop

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[workflow]: Description of the workflow that has produced this data entry. The workflow IDS can also be used to communicate information about workflow state between workflow components.
CONTAINER[workflow/time_loop]: Description of a workflow based on a time loop which calls components defined in component_list sequentially  during each cycle of the loop (workflow_cycle).

workflow/time_loop/workflow_cycle.documentation:
=== IMAS DATA DICTIONARY ENTRY ===
FULL_PATH: workflow/time_loop/workflow_cycle
IDS: workflow
HIERARCHY_DEPTH: 2
TOTAL_CONTEXT_LEVELS: 3
PARENT_CONTAINER: workflow/time_loop
FIELD_NAME: workflow_cycle
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: workflow -> time_loop -> workflow_cycle

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Set of time slices corresponding to the beginning of workflow cycles (main time loop of the workflow). During each workflow cycle, active components compute their result during their given time_interval. Components having completed their computation are frozen until the end of the workflow cycle. The next workflow cycle begins when the maximum time_interval (over the components) has been reached.

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[workflow]: Description of the workflow that has produced this data entry. The workflow IDS can also be used to communicate information about workflow state between workflow components.
CONTAINER[workflow/time_loop]: Description of a workflow based on a time loop which calls components defined in component_list sequentially  during each cycle of the loop (workflow_cycle).

IDS: workflow

FIELD_NAME: execution_mode
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Component execution mode for current workflow cycle. 0 means the component is not executed and the workflow uses results from previous workflow cycle. 1 means the component is executed for this workflow cycle.
